snippet: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police said Thursday that they had arrested at least 40 people in eastern New Brunswick at a violent protest over shale gas development.
abstract: Royal Canadian Mounted Police say they have arrested at least 40 people in eastern New Brunswick at a violent protest over shale gas development; say protesters had engaged in firearms violations, threats, intimidation, mischief and violation of a court-ordered injunction.
lead_paragraph: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police said Thursday that they had arrested at least 40 people in eastern New Brunswick at a violent protest over shale gas development.

headline.main: Canada: Shale Protest Ends in Arrests
headline.print_headline: Canada: Shale Protest Ends in Arrests
